qas.question: How does Oklahoma rank among US states for producing natural gas?
How does Oklahoma rank among US states for agriculture?
How does Oklahoma rank among US states for producing wheat?
How many Fortune 500 companies are based in Oklahoma?
How many Fortune 1000 companies are based in Oklahoma?

context: Oklahoma is host to a diverse range of sectors including aviation, energy, transportation equipment, food processing, electronics, and telecommunications. Oklahoma is an important producer of natural gas, aircraft, and food. The state ranks <a0_0>third<a0_0/> in the nation for production of natural gas, is the <a1_0>27th<a1_0/>-most agriculturally productive state, and also ranks <a2_0>5th<a2_0/> in production of wheat. <a3_0>Four<a3_0/> Fortune 500 companies and <a4_0>six<a4_0/> Fortune 1000 companies are headquartered in Oklahoma, and it has been rated one of the most business-friendly states in the nation, with the 7th-lowest tax burden in 2007.
